intro: Duroia plicata, commonly known as the arrow leaf or arrowhead plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive arrowhead-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are usually glossy and have a slightly waxy texture, while its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences. Duroia plicata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
